intro: Lomaria castanea, commonly known as the redroot lomatia, is a flowering plant native to western Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by pods containing several seeds. Lomaria castanea is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
